requirement_title: Implement and Maintain a Business Continuity Management System
requirement: Implement and maintain a BCMS
requirement_description: The organization must establish, implement, and maintain a Business Continuity Management System to ensure its ability to continue operations during disruptions.

controls.control: Develop, document, communicate, and enforce a comprehensive BCMS policy that outlines the organization's approach to business continuity.
Identify essential organizational functions and processes that must be maintained during a disruption to ensure business continuity.
Create detailed plans for each critical function, outlining the steps required to maintain operations during a disruption.
Provide training and awareness programs to employees on their roles and responsibilities in the BCMS, as well as any specific procedures they need to follow during a disruption.
Regularly test and exercise the BCMS plans to ensure their effectiveness, identify areas for improvement, and maintain employee familiarity with procedures.

requirement_title: Develop Business Continuity Policies and Objectives
requirement: Develop business continuity policies and objectives
requirement_description: The organization must define its business continuity policies and objectives to guide its BCMS.

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive BCP that outlines procedures to maintain critical business functions during and after a disruption.
Identify the potential impacts of various threats on the organization's operations, people, and assets to prioritize recovery efforts.
Outline strategies for recovering critical business functions, including alternative locations, personnel roles, and communication channels.

controls.control_title: Establish Regular Testing and Maintenance of BCP
controls.control: Regularly test and maintain the BCP to ensure its effectiveness in responding to disruptions.

requirement_title: Operate and Maintain Processes, Capabilities, and Response Structures
requirement: Operate and maintain processes, capabilities, and response structures
requirement_description: The organization must operate and maintain essential processes, capabilities, and response structures to ensure its survival during disruptions.

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive incident response plan to handle security incidents effectively and efficiently
Establish a formal change management process to ensure that all changes are properly planned, tested, and implemented in a controlled manner
Regularly backup critical systems and data to minimize the impact of system failures or security incidents

controls.control_title: Maintain Documentation of Processes and Procedures
controls.control: Document all key processes, procedures, and policies in a centralized location for easy access and reference
Regularly assess the organization's risk profile to identify potential vulnerabilities and take appropriate action to mitigate them

requirement_title: Monitor and Review BCMS Performance and Effectiveness
requirement: Monitor and review BCMS performance and effectiveness
requirement_description: The organization must monitor and review its BCMS to ensure it is functioning effectively.

controls.control: Establish a process to continuously monitor the BCMS's performance, including response times, system availability, and data integrity.
Conduct regular audits of the BCMS to ensure it is functioning as intended and identify any potential issues or areas for improvement.
Regularly review the effectiveness of the BCMS by simulating disaster scenarios and assessing the system's ability to recover and resume operations.
Implement a training and awareness program for users to ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities in the BCMS, as well as any changes or updates.
Maintain up-to-date documentation of the BCMS, including policies, procedures, and plans, to ensure they remain relevant and effective.

requirement_title: Implement Continual Improvement Based on Qualitative and Quantitative Measures
requirement: Implement continual improvement based on qualitative and quantitative measures
requirement_description: The organization must continuously improve its BCMS using both qualitative and quantitative data.

controls.control: Develop, document, and implement a formal continuous improvement program that includes regular reviews of processes, systems, and controls to identify areas for improvement.
Define and track KPIs relevant to the organization's objectives, such as customer satisfaction, process efficiency, and financial performance.
Regularly review the performance of key processes, systems, and controls against established KPIs to identify trends, areas for improvement, and opportunities for optimization.

Create mechanisms for employees, customers, and other stakeholders to provide feedback on processes, systems, and controls. Use this feedback to identify areas for improvement and make necessary adjustments.
Provide ongoing training and development opportunities for employees to ensure they have the skills and knowledge needed to effectively contribute to continual improvement efforts.

requirement_title: Establish a Policy for the BCMS
requirement: Establish a policy for the BCMS
requirement_description: The organization must create a policy that outlines its approach to business continuity.

controls.control: Clearly outline what systems, processes, and data are included in the BCMS, as well as the goals and expected outcomes of the BCMS.
Assign clear roles and responsibilities for BCMS management, including a BCMS owner, team members, and any external parties involved.
Create written policies and procedures that outline how to manage risks, respond to incidents, and maintain the BCMS effectively.
Provide training for employees on BCMS policies, procedures, and their roles in maintaining the BCMS.

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular BCMS Audits and Reviews
controls.control: Regularly review and audit the BCMS to ensure it remains effective, up-to-date, and compliant with any changes in regulations or business requirements.
Develop a plan for responding to incidents that could impact the BCMS, including clear steps for identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks.

requirement_title: Assign Competent People with Defined Responsibilities
requirement: Assign competent people with defined responsibilities
requirement_description: The organization must assign competent individuals to manage and maintain its BCMS.

controls.control: Clearly define job roles, responsibilities, and expectations for all employees to ensure they understand their duties and the impact of their work on the organization.
Create a clear organizational structure that outlines reporting lines, departments, and teams to ensure accountability and efficient communication.

controls.control_title: Provide Regular Training and Development Opportunities
controls.control: Offer regular training and development opportunities to employees to enhance their skills and knowledge, ensuring they remain competent in their roles.

requirement: Implement management processes for BCMS
requirement_description: The organization must implement all necessary management processes to ensure the effective functioning of its BCMS.

controls.control: Create, document, communicate, and maintain a comprehensive BCMS policy that outlines the organization's approach to business continuity.
Identify essential business functions and processes, their interdependencies, and the potential impact of disruptions on the organization's ability to operate.
Create detailed plans for each critical function or process, outlining steps to maintain operations during a disruption and ensure business continuity.
Assign responsibilities for managing the BCMS, including incident management, communication, and recovery efforts, to designated individuals or teams within the organization.
Provide regular training and exercises for BCMS team members to ensure they are familiar with their roles and responsibilities, as well as the BCMS plans and procedures.
Regularly review and update the BCMS policy, plans, and procedures to ensure they remain effective in addressing potential disruptions and are aligned with changes within the organization.

requirement_title: Provide Documented Information Supporting Operational Control and Performance Evaluation
requirement: Provide documented information supporting operational control and performance evaluation
requirement_description: The organization must maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation to support its BCMS operations and performance evaluation.

controls.control: Create, maintain, and distribute a comprehensive manual detailing all operational procedures, including performance evaluation criteria.
Define key performance indicators (KPIs) for each role and department to measure efficiency and effectiveness.
Create a written process outlining how performance evaluations will be conducted, including frequency, criteria, and documentation requirements.

requirement: The organization must protect life, property and the environment.
requirement_description: The organization is obligated to ensure safety of lives, properties, and the environment.

controls.control: Develop and maintain a comprehensive emergency response plan that includes procedures for evacuation, first aid, fire safety, and hazardous material spills.
Establish a schedule for regular maintenance of all equipment to prevent malfunctions that could potentially cause harm or damage.
Regularly monitor and report on compliance with environmental regulations, including waste management, emissions, and water usage.
Develop and implement a safety training program for all employees to ensure they are aware of potential hazards and proper safety procedures.

requirement: The organization must consider the expectations of its interested parties.
requirement_description: The organization is expected to take into account the views and needs of its stakeholders.

controls.control: Create a dedicated communication channel to regularly engage with interested parties, understand their expectations, and address any concerns or feedback
Develop a documented process for identifying, categorizing, and managing the expectations of interested parties

controls.control_title: Train Staff on Understanding Interested Parties Expectations
controls.control: Provide training to staff members on understanding and addressing the expectations of interested parties, including suppliers, customers, employees, and shareholders

requirement_title: Providing Confidence in Organization's Ability to Succeed
requirement: The organization must instill confidence in its ability to achieve success.
requirement_description: The organization is required to demonstrate its capability and reliability to stakeholders.

controls.control: Develop measurable, achievable objectives that align with the organization's mission and vision
Ensure consistent, transparent, and timely communication to all stakeholders about the organization's goals, progress, and successes

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Business Continuity Plan
controls.control: Maintain a comprehensive business continuity plan to ensure the organization can continue operations during unexpected events or crises

requirement_title: Improving Internal Processes Effectiveness During Disruptions
requirement: The organization must enhance its ability to continue operations during disruptions.
requirement_description: The organization is expected to develop resilience and adaptability in the face of unexpected events.

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive disaster recovery plan that outlines steps to be taken in the event of a disruption, including data backup and restoration procedures, alternative work locations, and communication protocols.
Install redundant systems for critical infrastructure to ensure continuity of operations during disruptions. This may include backup power supplies, duplicate servers, and mirrored databases.

Regularly conduct disaster simulations to test the effectiveness of the disaster recovery plan and identify areas for improvement. This will help ensure that the organization is prepared to respond effectively in the event of a disruption.
Establish and maintain an offsite backup location for critical data. This will ensure that data can be recovered in the event of a disruption at the primary location.

Develop and implement a communication strategy to keep employees, customers, and other stakeholders informed during a disruption. This may include regular updates via email, social media, or a dedicated website.

requirement: The organization must show effective and efficient risk management.
requirement_description: The organization is required to identify, assess, and manage risks in a timely and appropriate manner.

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive risk management framework that outlines the organization's approach to identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks.
Regularly conduct risk assessments to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities, and prioritize them based on their impact and likelihood.
Create and maintain written policies that outline the organization's risk management approach, roles, responsibilities, and procedures.
Develop a plan for responding to identified risks, including strategies for mitigation, acceptance, avoidance, or transfer.
Regularly monitor the effectiveness of risk management controls and report on risks, issues, and incidents to relevant stakeholders.

and Act (maintain and improve) (PDCA) cycle to implement, maintain and continually improve the

applicable to the organization, as well as needs, requirements and scope.  
• — Clause 5 summarizes the requirements specific to top management’s role in the BCMS, 
and how leadership articulates its expectations to the organization via a policy statement.  
• — Clause 6 describes the requirements for establishing strategic objectives and guiding 
principles for the BCMS as a whole. 
• — Clause 7 supports BCMS operations related to establishing competence and 
communication on a recurring/as-needed basis with interested parties, while documenting, 
controlling, maintaining and retaining required documented information. 
• — Clause 8 defines business continuity needs, determines how to address them and 
develops procedures to manage the organization during a disruption. 
• — Clause 9 summarizes the requirements necessary to measure business continuity 
performance, BCMS conformity with this document, and to conduct management review.  
• — Clause 10 identifies and acts on BCMS nonconformity and continual improvement through 
corrective action.

1   Scope 
This document specifies requirements to implement, maintain and improve a management system to 
protect against, reduce the likelihood of the occurrence of, prepare for, respond to and recover from 
disruptions when they arise. 
The requirements specified in this document are generic and intended to be applicable to all 
organizations, or parts thereof, regardless of type, size and nature of the organization. The extent of 
application of these requirements depends on the organization’s operating environment and 
complexity. 
This document is applicable to all types and sizes of organizations that: 
• a) implement, maintain and improve a BCMS; 
• b) seek to ensure conformity with stated business continuity policy; 
• c) need to be able to continue to deliver products and services at an acceptable predefined 
capacity during a disruption; 
• d) seek to enhance their resilience through the effective application of the BCMS.

needs and obligations.

4   Context of the organization 
4.1   Understanding the organization and its context 
The organization shall determine external and internal issues that are relevant to its purpose and that 
affect its ability to achieve the intended outcome(s) of its BCMS. 
NOTE These issues will be influenced by the organization’s overall objectives, its products and 
services and the amount and type of risk that it may or may not take.

• a) the interested parties that are relevant to the BCMS;

• a) implement and maintain a process to identify, have access to, and assess the applicable 
legal and regulatory requirements related to the continuity of its products and services, 
activities and resources;

account in implementing and maintaining its BCMS;

requirement: The organization shall establish the scope of the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)

controls.control: Create a formal document detailing any exceptions made when defining the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) scope, including reasons for such exceptions.

controls.control_title: Regular Review of BCMS Scope Exceptions

requirement: The organization shall implement, maintain, and continuously improve the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)

requirement: Top management shall demonstrate leadership and commitment towards the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)
requirement_description: Top management is responsible for ensuring the BCMS is compatible with the organization's strategic direction, integrated into business processes, adequately resourced, communicated effectively, and continually improved.

controls.control: Develop and publicly communicate a clear, concise, and regularly updated statement from top management demonstrating their commitment to the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS).

integrity).

activities, as applicable: 
• a) distribution, access, retrieval and use; 
• b) storage and preservation, including preservation of legibility;

The organization shall plan, implement and control the processes needed to meet requirements, and 
to implement the actions determined in 6.1, by: 
• a) establishing criteria for the processes; 
• b) implementing control of the processes in accordance with the criteria; 
• c) keeping documented information to the extent necessary to have confidence that the 
processes have been carried out as planned. 
The organization shall control planned changes and review the consequences of unintended 
changes, taking action to mitigate any adverse effects, as necessary.  
The organization shall ensure that outsourced processes and the supply chain are controlled.  
8.2   Business impact analysis and risk assessment 
8.2.1   General 
The organization shall: 
• a) implement and maintain systematic processes for analysing the business impact and 
assessing the risks of disruption; 
• b) review the business impact analysis and risk assessment at planned intervals and when 
there are significant changes within the organization or the context in which it operates.  
NOTE The organization determines the order in which the business impact analysis and risk 
assessment are conducted. 
8.2.2   Business impact analysis 
The organization shall use the process for analysing business impacts to determine business 
continuity priorities and requirements. The process shall: 
• a) define the impact types and criteria relevant to the organization’s context;  
• b) identify the activities that support the provision of products and services;  
• c) use the impact types and criteria for assessing the impacts over time resulting from the 
disruption of these activities; 
• d) identify the time frame within which the impacts of not resuming activities would become 
unacceptable to the organization; 
NOTE 1 This time frame can be referred to as the "maximum tolerable period of disruption 
(MTPD)". 
• e) set prioritized time frames within the time identified in d) for resuming disrupted activities at 
a specified minimum acceptable capacity; 
NOTE 2 This time frame can be referred to as the "recovery time objective (RTO)".  
• f) use this analysis to identify prioritized activities; 
• g) determine which resources are needed to support prioritized activities; 
• h) determine the dependencies, including partners and suppliers, and interdependencies of 
prioritized activities. 
8.2.3   Risk assessment 
The organization shall implement and maintain a risk assessment process.

unacceptable to the organization;

• e) set prioritized time frames within the time identified in d) for resuming disrupted activities at 
a specified minimum acceptable capacity; 
NOTE 2 This time frame can be referred to as the "recovery time objective (RTO)".  
• f) use this analysis to identify prioritized activities; 
• g) determine which resources are needed to support prioritized activities; 
• h) determine the dependencies, including partners and suppliers, and interdependencies of 
prioritized activities.

controls.control: Create a comprehensive map of all internal and external dependencies related to the plan, including software, hardware, services, and personnel.
Implement procedures for notifying relevant parties when changes occur in dependencies that may impact the plan's execution.
Regularly monitor updates and changes to internal and external dependencies, and assess their potential impact on the plan's execution.

requirement: Determine the resources (human, material, financial, etc.) required for the plan's execution
requirement_description: Knowing the resources needed ensures that they are available when required.

controls.control_title: Establish a Resource Requirements Analysis Team
controls.control: Form a team responsible for identifying, quantifying, and documenting all resources (human, material, financial) required for the plan's execution
Create a model to estimate resource requirements based on historical data and project scope
Prepare a comprehensive document detailing the estimated resources required for the plan's execution, including contingencies and justifications

requirement: Establish reporting requirements for the plan's progress and results
requirement_description: Regular reporting helps monitor the plan's progress and identify any deviations from the expected outcomes.

controls.control: Develop a schedule for regular reports on the status of the project, including key milestones and deliverables. Reports should be distributed to relevant stakeholders.
Use a project management tool or system to track progress, assign tasks, and monitor deadlines. This will help ensure that the team is on track and can identify any potential issues early.
Develop a standard format for progress reports to ensure consistency, clarity, and ease of understanding. This will help stakeholders quickly understand the status of the project.

Schedule regular meetings with relevant stakeholders to discuss progress, address any issues, and make adjustments as necessary. This will help ensure that the project is on track and that everyone is aligned.

requirement: Develop a process for ending the plan's execution when it is no longer needed or required
requirement_description: A standdown process helps ensure that resources are not wasted and that any ongoing activities are properly concluded.

controls.control: Develop and document a clear policy outlining the criteria for terminating a plan, including triggers, responsible parties, and timelines.
Regularly review plans to assess their relevance, effectiveness, and necessity. Schedule periodic reviews based on the plan's lifecycle or changes in business requirements.
Document step-by-step procedures for deactivating a plan, including data backup, system access removal, and communication to relevant parties.
Develop protocols for notifying all relevant parties when a plan is terminated, including internal teams, external partners, and data subjects (if applicable).

requirement: Make sure that the plan is accessible when needed
requirement_description: Having a readily available plan is essential for a quick response to disruptions.

controls.control: Establish and enforce access control policies to ensure only authorized personnel can access the plan.
Use secure storage solutions, such as encrypted databases or secure file servers, to protect the plan from unauthorized access.
Implement a regular backup schedule to ensure the plan can be recovered in case of data loss or system failure.
Create and maintain documentation outlining procedures for accessing the plan, including who has access, how to request access, and emergency access procedures.

requirement: Develop and document recovery processes for returning business activities to normal following a disruption
requirement_description: Recovery processes help minimize the impact of disruptions on business operations.

controls.control: Create a comprehensive DRP that outlines steps to be taken during and after a disaster, including data backup procedures, system recovery, and communication with stakeholders.
Schedule regular backups of critical business data and systems to ensure that data can be quickly restored in the event of a disruption.
Create a BCP that outlines how essential business functions will continue during and after a disruption, including alternative work locations, communication channels, and resource allocation.
Regularly test the DRP and BCP to ensure that they are effective and up-to-date, and make any necessary adjustments based on the results of these tests.
Keep current documentation of all recovery processes, including the DRP, BCP, and backup procedures, and ensure that they are easily accessible to relevant personnel in the event of a disruption.

requirement: The organization shall implement and maintain an exercise programme for validating the effectiveness of its business continuity strategies and solutions.
requirement_description: The organization must regularly test and validate its business continuity plans to ensure they are effective.

controls.control: Design and execute periodic simulations, drills, or tabletop exercises to test the organization's business continuity strategies and solutions.
Develop detailed procedures for conducting business continuity exercises, including roles, responsibilities, and expected outcomes.
Analyze the results of each exercise to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions as necessary.
Keep records of all business continuity exercises, including the type of exercise, date, participants, and findings, for future reference and continuous improvement.

requirement: Exercises and tests should be consistent with the organization's business continuity objectives.
requirement_description: The organization must ensure that its testing and exercise activities align with its overall business continuity goals.

controls.control_title: Align Test Scenarios with Business Continuity Objectives
controls.control: Develop test scenarios that simulate potential disruptions and recovery strategies in line with the organization's business continuity objectives.

controls.control_title: Regularly Review and Update Test Scenarios
controls.control: Establish a schedule for reviewing and updating test scenarios to ensure they remain relevant and effective in achieving the organization's business continuity objectives.

controls.control_title: Document Test Results and Lessons Learned
controls.control: Maintain records of test results, including any lessons learned, to inform future exercises and improvements in the organization's business continuity plans.

requirement: Exercises and tests should be based on well-planned, relevant scenarios.
requirement_description: The organization must design its testing activities using realistic and meaningful scenarios to effectively evaluate its business continuity plans.

controls.control: Create test cases that simulate real-world scenarios to ensure the exercises are relevant and effective.
Periodically review and update the exercise and test scenarios to keep them current and relevant.
Maintain a record of why each scenario was chosen, to help justify their relevance and provide traceability.

requirement_title: Develop Teamwork, Competence, Confidence, and Knowledge
requirement: Exercises and tests should foster teamwork, competence, confidence, and knowledge among staff responsible for handling disruptions.
requirement_description: The organization must ensure that its testing activities help build the necessary skills and confidence among its staff to effectively respond to disruptions.

controls.control: Conduct regular team training sessions focusing on handling disruptions, emphasizing teamwork, competence, confidence, and knowledge.
Design exercises that involve multiple departments or functions to simulate real-world disruptions and promote collaboration.
Establish a platform for staff to share their knowledge, experiences, and best practices related to handling disruptions.
Implement a system for peer review and feedback during exercises and tests to encourage continuous learning and improvement.

requirement_title: Validate Business Continuity Strategies and Solutions
requirement: Exercise results should collectively validate the organization's business continuity strategies and solutions.
requirement_description: The organization must use the results of its testing activities to confirm that its business continuity plans are effective.

controls.control: Perform regular, scheduled exercises to test the effectiveness of business continuity plans, including disaster recovery scenarios.

controls.control_title: Evaluate Exercise Results and Improve Plans
controls.control: Analyze exercise results to identify areas for improvement in business continuity plans and implement changes as necessary.
Maintain a record of lessons learned during exercises, including best practices, areas for improvement, and recommendations for future exercises.

requirement: Post-exercise reports should detail the results, recommendations, and actions for improvement.
requirement_description: The organization must document the findings from its testing activities and provide actionable recommendations for improvement.

controls.control: Post-exercise reports should include a comprehensive analysis of the exercise's outcomes, including successes, failures, and lessons learned.
Each report should provide actionable recommendations to improve future exercises based on the findings from the post-exercise analysis.
Include an action plan in the post-exercise report, outlining specific steps to be taken and responsible parties for each task.

requirement_title: Review Exercises within Context of Continual Improvement
requirement: Exercise reviews should be conducted with a focus on continuous improvement.
requirement_description: The organization must use its testing activities as an opportunity to identify areas for improvement and make necessary adjustments.

controls.control: Establish a schedule for regular exercise review meetings, ideally monthly or bi-monthly, to discuss areas of improvement and implement changes.
Create a standardized format for documenting exercise findings and recommendations. This will facilitate the tracking of issues over time and ensure that improvements are not overlooked.

Create a simple tracker to monitor the progress of implemented improvements from previous exercise reviews. This will help in measuring the effectiveness of changes and identifying any potential recurring issues.

requirement: Exercises should be conducted according to a schedule and during times of significant change.
requirement_description: The organization must regularly test its business continuity plans and adjust them as needed based on changes within the organization or its operating environment.

controls.control: Establish a regular exercise schedule and ensure it is followed, with exceptions made only for times of significant change.
Develop contingency plans for conducting exercises during periods of significant change and ensure they are tested regularly.
Maintain records of exercise results, including those conducted during times of significant change, for review and analysis.

requirement: The organization must make necessary changes based on the findings from its testing activities.
requirement_description: The organization must take action to address any weaknesses or gaps identified during its testing activities.

controls.control: Upon completion of testing activities, a dedicated team should review and address all findings within the agreed timeline.
Create a comprehensive report detailing all testing findings, including their impact, recommended actions, and responsible parties.
Regularly review and update testing procedures to ensure they are effective in identifying potential issues and improving system performance.

requirement_title: Evaluate Business Continuity Documentation and Capabilities
requirement: The organization must regularly evaluate the suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness of its business continuity documentation and capabilities.
requirement_description: The organization must assess whether its business continuity plans are appropriate, sufficient, and effective in addressing potential disruptions.

controls.control: Conduct a thorough review of the business continuity documentation at least annually, or more frequently if significant changes occur within the organization.
Update the Business Impact Analysis (BIA) to reflect any changes in the organization's operations, systems, or dependencies.

controls.control_title: Test and Exercise Business Continuity Plans
controls.control: Regularly test and exercise business continuity plans to ensure they remain effective in the event of a disruption.
Implement a version control system for the business continuity documentation to track changes and maintain an audit trail.

requirement: Evaluations should be conducted using various methods such as reviews, analysis, testing, post-incident reports, and performance evaluations.
requirement_description: The organization must use a variety of evaluation techniques to ensure a comprehensive assessment of its business continuity plans.

controls.control: Establish a schedule for regular evaluation reviews to assess the effectiveness and efficiency of processes, systems, and personnel.
Develop standardized analytical methods to be used during evaluations for consistent results and improved decision-making.
Incorporate testing procedures into the evaluation process to identify potential issues and areas for improvement.
Create a system for documenting post-incident reports and include them in the evaluation process to learn from past mistakes and improve resilience.

controls.control_title: Incorporate Performance Evaluations in Overall Assessment
controls.control: Include performance evaluations of personnel as part of the overall assessment during evaluations to ensure accountability and continuous improvement.

requirement_title: Evaluate Business Continuity Capabilities of Relevant Partners
requirement: The organization must assess the business continuity capabilities of its partners and suppliers.
requirement_description: The organization must ensure that its critical third parties have adequate business continuity plans in place.

controls.control_title: Assess Business Continuity Plans of Partners and Suppliers
controls.control: Regularly review the business continuity plans of partners and suppliers to ensure they can continue operations in case of disruptions. This includes assessing their disaster recovery capabilities, contingency plans, and risk management strategies.

controls.control_title: Establish Communication Channels with Partners and Suppliers
controls.control: Maintain open lines of communication with partners and suppliers to ensure timely updates about their business continuity status, potential disruptions, and recovery efforts.

controls.control_title: Perform Risk Assessments on Partners and Suppliers
controls.control: Regularly evaluate the risks associated with each partner or supplier, considering factors such as their geographical location, industry, and operational resilience.
Develop a list of potential alternate suppliers in case the primary supplier is unable to fulfill their obligations due to disruptions.

requirement_title: Evaluate Compliance with Legal and Regulatory Requirements
requirement: The organization must ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, industry standards, and its own business continuity policy.
requirement_description: The organization must adhere to all applicable legal and regulatory requirements related to business continuity planning.

controls.control: Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards
Regularly review and update business continuity policy to align with changes in laws, regulations, and industry standards
Provide training and awareness programs for employees on relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards

requirement_title: Update Documentation and Procedures in a Timely Manner
requirement: Documentation and procedures should be updated as needed.
requirement_description: The organization must keep its business continuity plans current to reflect changes within the organization or its operating environment.

controls.control: Establish a regular schedule for reviewing and updating all documentation, such as policies, procedures, and standards.
Develop a formal process to manage changes in the documentation, ensuring that all updates are properly tracked, tested, and approved before implementation.
Implement version control for all documentation to maintain a clear history of changes and allow easy rollback if necessary.

requirement_title: Monitor, Measure, Analyze, and Evaluate Performance
requirement: The organization must establish a system for monitoring, measuring, analyzing, and evaluating its performance.
requirement_description: The organization must have mechanisms in place to track and assess its performance in relation to its business continuity plans.

controls.control: Develop a set of key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the organization's performance in various areas.
Deploy software tools that automatically collect and analyze data related to the organization's performance.
Schedule regular meetings or assign specific personnel to review performance reports and identify areas for improvement.

controls.control: Regularly assess the potential impact of business disruptions on critical processes, systems, and assets to identify key areas for improvement in the BCMS.

controls.control_title: Establish a Business Continuity Plan Review Schedule
controls.control: Develop a schedule for reviewing and updating the business continuity plan at regular intervals to ensure its relevance and effectiveness.
Periodically test the BCMS through exercises, drills, or simulations to evaluate its performance and identify areas for improvement.

requirement: The organization shall conduct internal audits of its BCMS

controls.control_title: Conduct Regular Internal Audits of BCMS
controls.control: Establish a schedule for internal audits of the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) to ensure its effectiveness and compliance with organizational policies and industry standards.
Assign a dedicated team responsible for conducting internal audits of the BCMS, ensuring they have the necessary skills and training to perform their duties effectively.
Develop a comprehensive checklist outlining all aspects of the BCMS that should be audited, including policies, procedures, plans, and training programs.
Maintain a record of audit findings, including any non-compliance issues identified during the audit process, and track progress towards resolution.
Develop and implement corrective actions based on audit findings to address any non-compliance issues and improve the overall effectiveness of the BCMS.

requirement: The organization shall ensure that the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) conforms to its own requirements and the requirements of this document, and is effectively implemented and maintained.
requirement_description: The BCMS must adhere to both internal policies and the standards outlined in the compliance document, and it should be functioning properly.

controls.control: Conduct regular reviews of the organization's BCMS requirements and this document to ensure alignment and compliance.
Maintain comprehensive documentation detailing the implementation of the BCMS, including policies, procedures, and plans.
Regularly update and maintain the BCMS to reflect changes in the organization's operations, risks, and business environment.

controls.control_title: Training and Awareness Program for BCMS
controls.control: Establish a training and awareness program to ensure all relevant personnel understand their roles and responsibilities in the BCMS.

requirement: The organization shall create, implement, and maintain a comprehensive audit program that outlines the frequency, methods, responsibilities, planning requirements, and reporting.
requirement_description: The audit program should be designed to assess the BCMS's effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.

controls.control: Develop a comprehensive audit program outlining the frequency, methods, responsibilities, planning requirements, and reporting.
Designate specific individuals or departments responsible for conducting audits and ensuring their competency.
Create a schedule detailing the timing, scope, and objectives of each audit activity.
Prepare reports summarizing the results of each audit, including any identified issues, recommendations for improvement, and actions taken to address them.
Regularly review and update the audit program to ensure its effectiveness in identifying risks and maintaining compliance.

requirement: The organization shall clearly define the criteria and scope for each audit.
requirement_description: This ensures that audits are focused and consistent, allowing for accurate assessments of the BCMS.

controls.control: Create a comprehensive list of what will be audited, including systems, processes, and data, along with the specific criteria for each.
Define the geographical, functional, and temporal boundaries of each audit to ensure a focused and efficient process.
Maintain up-to-date documentation detailing the criteria and scope for each audit, making it easily accessible to relevant stakeholders.

requirement: The organization shall choose auditors and conduct audits in a manner that ensures objectivity and impartiality.
requirement_description: Auditors should be selected based on their ability to provide unbiased assessments.

controls.control: Create a committee responsible for the selection of auditors, ensuring transparency and fairness in the process.
Develop clear criteria for evaluating potential auditors based on their expertise, independence, and reputation.
Regularly rotate the auditing firm to prevent any potential conflicts of interest or bias in audit findings.
Establish a policy that prohibits auditors from having personal, financial, or business relationships with the organization that could potentially influence their objectivity.

controls.control_title: Provide Auditor Training on Objectivity and Impartiality
controls.control: Offer regular training sessions to auditors on maintaining objectivity and impartiality in their work.

requirement: The organization shall report the results of audits to relevant managers.
requirement_description: Audit findings should be communicated to those who can take action based on the results.

controls.control: Develop a formal process for reporting audit results to relevant managers, ensuring timeliness and clarity of information
Identify and document the specific individuals or roles responsible for receiving and acting upon audit reports within the organization
Create and maintain an organized archive of all completed audits, including their results and any subsequent actions taken, for future reference and compliance purposes

requirement: The organization shall document the implementation of the audit program and the results of audits.
requirement_description: Documentation provides a record of the BCMS's performance over time.

controls.control: Create a comprehensive document detailing the steps taken to implement the audit program, including objectives, scope, and timelines.
Regularly update the audit program documentation to reflect any changes or updates made to the program.
Maintain a secure and accessible storage location for all audit results, ensuring confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the data.

requirement: The organization shall promptly address any identified issues and their root causes.
requirement_description: Corrective actions should be taken in a timely manner to maintain the effectiveness of the BCMS.

controls.control: Implement a system to log, prioritize, and track identified issues and their root causes
Create a documented procedure for identifying and addressing the underlying reasons of an issue
Establish a policy to escalate unresolved issues to higher levels of management or relevant teams

requirement: The organization shall verify that corrective actions have been implemented and report the results of these verifications.
requirement_description: Verification ensures that corrective actions have been effectively implemented.

controls.control_title: Verify Corrective Actions Implementation - Periodic Audits
controls.control: Regularly schedule and conduct audits to ensure that all corrective actions have been implemented as intended. Document findings, actions taken, and outcomes.

controls.control_title: Verify Corrective Actions Implementation - Management Reviews
controls.control: Establish a process for management to review the status of corrective actions on a regular basis. This includes tracking progress, identifying any delays or issues, and ensuring resolution.

controls.control_title: Verify Corrective Actions Implementation - Employee Feedback
controls.control: Encourage employees to report on the implementation of corrective actions. This can help identify any issues or areas for improvement, and demonstrate employee engagement in compliance efforts.

requirement: Top management shall periodically review the BCMS to ensure its continued relevance, sufficiency, and effectiveness.
requirement_description: Regular reviews help maintain the BCMS's alignment with changing business needs.

controls.control_title: Periodic BCMS Review by Top Management
controls.control: Top management shall conduct a comprehensive review of the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) at least annually, or more frequently if significant changes occur within the organization.
Top management shall document findings from the BCMS review, including any identified gaps, non-conformities, or areas for improvement, and take appropriate corrective actions.

controls.control_title: Update BCMS Based on Review Findings
controls.control: Top management shall update the BCMS based on the findings from the review, ensuring that any identified gaps or areas for improvement are addressed and the BCMS remains relevant, sufficient, and effective.
Top management shall maintain a record of BCMS review dates to ensure regular and timely reviews are conducted.

requirement: Top management shall consider various factors during the BCMS review.
requirement_description: Factors such as nonconformities, performance trends, feedback from interested parties, and risks should be taken into account during the review.

controls.control: Regularly review the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) to ensure it remains relevant, up-to-date, and comprehensive in addressing potential threats and business disruptions.

controls.control_title: Identify Key Stakeholders for BCMS Review
controls.control: Establish a clear list of key stakeholders involved in the BCMS review process, including top management, functional departments, and external parties as necessary.
Prepare a report detailing the findings from the BCMS review, outlining any gaps, weaknesses, or areas for improvement, and propose corrective actions where necessary.
Establish a schedule for periodic BCMS reviews to ensure that the system remains effective in addressing evolving business risks and threats.

requirement: Ensure that all risks and issues identified as unaddressed in previous risk assessments are properly addressed.
requirement_description: The organization must revisit and address any risks or issues that were not adequately handled in past risk assessments.

controls.control_title: Address Unaddressed Risks from Previous Risk Assessments
controls.control: Conduct a thorough review of all risks and issues identified as unaddressed in previous risk assessments. Develop and implement remediation plans for each identified issue, ensuring that they are fully addressed within a specified timeframe.
Implement a system to track risks and issues identified during risk assessments. This system should allow for easy monitoring, updating, and reporting of the status of each risk or issue.

Schedule regular reviews of previous risk assessments to ensure that all risks and issues have been properly addressed. This review should also identify any new risks or issues that may have arisen since the last assessment.

requirement: Learn from past incidents (near-misses and disruptions) to improve future operations.
requirement_description: The organization should analyze past incidents to identify lessons learned and implement necessary actions to prevent similar occurrences in the future.

controls.control: Develop a structured process to review each incident, identify root causes, and propose corrective actions.
Create a system for employees to report near-misses or potential incidents, ensuring confidentiality and no repercussions.
Review and update incident response plans based on lessons learned from past incidents to ensure they remain effective.

requirement: Seek opportunities to improve and make continuous improvements in the organization's operations.
requirement_description: The organization should be open to identifying and implementing improvements in its processes, systems, or practices.

controls.control: Develop and implement a formal program that encourages employees to identify areas for improvement, suggest solutions, and track progress.
Create visual representations of business processes to identify inefficiencies, redundancies, and opportunities for automation or streamlining.
Regularly review the performance of key business processes to identify areas that require improvement and implement corrective actions as needed.

requirement_title: BCMS Tent Review and Continual Improvement
requirement: The organization shall conduct a review of the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) and identify opportunities for improvement.
requirement_description: Regular reviews are necessary to ensure the BCMS remains effective and efficient. This includes assessing the scope, updating business impact analysis, risk assessment, strategies and plans, modifying procedures and controls, measuring control effectiveness, and making changes as needed.

controls.control: Establish a regular review schedule for the BCMS, ideally annually or bi-annually
Maintain a record of identified opportunities for improvement and actions taken to address them
Provide regular training sessions on BCMS policies, procedures, and best practices to all employees

requirement: The organization shall document the results of its BCMS management review and retain this documentation.
requirement_description: Documenting the results of management reviews is essential for accountability, transparency, and future reference.

controls.control: Establish a formal process to document the results of BCMS management reviews, including action items, decisions made, and follow-up activities. Retain these records securely for a specified period.
Designate a specific individual or team responsible for documenting the BCMS management review results and ensuring their timely completion.
Define a retention period for BCMS management review documentation, considering factors such as legal requirements, industry best practices, and the organization's risk appetite.

requirement: The organization shall address nonconformities and improve its BCMS based on opportunities for improvement.
requirement_description: Nonconformities should be addressed promptly, and improvements made to ensure the BCMS remains effective. This includes evaluating the cause of nonconformities, implementing corrective actions, reviewing their effectiveness, and making changes as needed.

controls.control: Develop a formal process to identify, document, investigate, and resolve nonconformities in a timely manner
Create a plan to address the root cause of nonconformities and prevent recurrence, including setting deadlines for completion
Perform periodic audits to assess the effectiveness of the BCMS and identify opportunities for improvement
Develop a program to continuously review, evaluate, and improve the organization's BCMS based on lessons learned and best practices

requirement_title: Retain Documentation of Nonconformity and Corrective Actions
requirement: The organization shall document the nature of nonconformities, any subsequent actions taken, and the results of any corrective action.
requirement_description: Documenting nonconformities and their resolution is crucial for accountability, transparency, and future reference.

controls.control: Maintain a comprehensive record of all nonconformities, actions taken to address them, and the results of any corrective action. This includes details such as the nature of the nonconformity, the date it was identified, the action taken, the person responsible for the action, the date the action was completed, and the outcome.

Implement a system to efficiently report, track, and manage nonconformities. This includes a user-friendly interface for reporting, automatic assignment of responsibilities, and a dashboard for monitoring progress.

Conduct regular reviews of nonconformity records to identify trends, recurring issues, and areas for improvement. Use the insights gained from these reviews to refine processes and prevent future nonconformities.

requirement: The organization shall continuously improve the BCMS based on analysis, evaluation, and management review results.
requirement_description: Continual improvement is essential for ensuring the BCMS remains effective in protecting business operations.

controls.control: Conduct regular audits of the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) to identify areas for improvement and ensure compliance with established policies and procedures.

controls.control_title: Analysis and Evaluation of BCMS Performance
controls.control: Regularly analyze and evaluate the performance of the BCMS, including incident response times, effectiveness of plans, and overall system resilience. Use this data to identify areas for improvement.

controls.control_title: Management Review of BCMS Improvement Recommendations
controls.control: Establish a process for the management team to review and act upon recommendations for BCMS improvement, ensuring that identified issues are addressed in a timely manner.

requirement_title: Identify Needs or Opportunities for Continual Improvement
article_text:
The organization shall consider the results of analysis and evaluation, and the outputs from 
management review, to determine if there are needs or opportunities, relating to the business, or to 
the BCMS, that shall be addressed as part of continual improvement. 
NOTE The organization can use the processes of the BCMS, such as leadership, planning and 
performance evaluation, to achieve improvement.
requirement: Identify needs or opportunities for improvement in the business or BCMS
requirement_description: The organization must assess its performance and identify areas for improvement within the business and Business Continuity Management System (BCMS)

controls.control: Perform a comprehensive Business Impact Analysis (BIA) to identify critical business functions, processes, and systems, and their dependencies.
Review and update the Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) annually or as needed to ensure it remains effective and relevant.
Implement ongoing training and awareness programs for staff to ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities in the BCMS, as well as any changes or updates.
Conduct regular risk assessments to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities, and implement appropriate controls to mitigate these risks.
